articles.headline: Endowment Sweepstakes: How Tiny Houghton College Beat Harvard
articles.snippet: Houghton College outperformed colleges with the biggest endowments by getting out of hedge funds and moving to a mix of low-cost index funds and mutual funds.
articles.abstract: Houghton College outperformed colleges with the biggest endowments by getting out of hedge funds and moving to a mix of low-cost index funds and mutual funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hotly competitive returns of college endowment performance are out, and the results have again shaken the higher education elite down to their Ivy League roots: The smallest endowments — those with total assets under $25 million — outperformed their billion-dollar-plus rivals for the second year.

articles.headline: Trump May Turn to Arab Allies for Help With Israeli-Palestinian Relations
articles.snippet: The emerging approach mirrors the thinking of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who visits Washington next week, and also of past American administrations.
articles.abstract: The emerging approach mirrors the thinking of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who visits Washington next week, and also of past American administrations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and his advisers, venturing for the first time into the fraught world of Middle East peacemaking, are developing a strategy on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict that would enlist Arab nations like Saudi Arabia and Egypt to break years of deadlock.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Kellyanne Conway Promotes Ivanka Trump Brand, Raising Ethics Concerns
articles.snippet: “Go buy Ivanka’s stuff is what I would say,” Ms. Conway said on Fox, after Nordstrom dropped Ms. Trump’s fashion products.
articles.abstract: “Go buy Ivanka’s stuff is what I would say,” Ms. Conway said on Fox, after Nordstrom dropped Ms. Trump’s fashion products.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House on Thursday “counseled” Kellyanne Conway, one of President Trump’s top advisers, in an unusual show of displeasure after she urged consumers to buy fashion products marketed by Ivanka Trump, the president’s daughter. Legal experts said Ms. Conway might have violated a federal ethics rule against endorsing products or promoting an associate’s financial interests.
articles.byline: By Richard Pérez-Peña and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: Court Refuses to Reinstate Travel Ban, Dealing Trump Another Legal Loss
articles.snippet: The ruling, the first from an appeals court on the travel ban, is likely to be quickly appealed to the short-handed United States Supreme Court.
articles.abstract: The ruling, the first from an appeals court on the travel ban, is likely to be quickly appealed to the short-handed United States Supreme Court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal appeals panel on Thursday unanimously rejected President Trump’s bid to reinstate his ban on travel into the United States from seven largely Muslim nations, a sweeping rebuke of the administration’s claim that the courts have no role as a check on the president.

articles.headline: Investing in the Pain of Student Debt Is a Tough but Tempting Play
articles.snippet: Seeing $1.4 trillion in student debt as a market liability, some analysts and hedge funds are betting on defaults. But it’s a tricky trade.
articles.abstract: Seeing $1.4 trillion in student debt as a market liability, some analysts and hedge funds are betting on defaults. But it’s a tricky trade.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a college student in the early 1990s, Charles Trafton worked nights at a student-loan collection agency in Boston’s theater district, calling trucking and beauty school dropouts to ask them for money.

articles.headline: Do You Need to Worry About Trump’s Reforms? It Depends
articles.snippet: The president pledged to do “a big number” on the Dodd-Frank Act. If, instead, lawmakers propose only some basic fixes, don’t despair.
articles.abstract: The president pledged to do “a big number” on the Dodd-Frank Act. If, instead, lawmakers propose only some basic fixes, don’t despair.
articles.lead_paragraph: I get it: You are freaked out. You don’t like this president. Practically every day, he sets off some new crisis and, according to your Facebook feed, does something that might destroy the nation. You’re wondering if you should start buying canned foods and ammunition.

articles.headline: Neil Gorsuch’s Criticism Wasn’t Aimed at Trump, Aides Say in Reversal
articles.snippet: The Trump administration’s abrupt shift highlighted how Judge Gorsuch’s Supreme Court nomination has become mired in the president’s feud with the judiciary.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration’s abrupt shift highlighted how Judge Gorsuch’s Supreme Court nomination has become mired in the president’s feud with the judiciary.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — White House officials insisted on Thursday that Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, was not referring to Mr. Trump’s recent denigration of judges when he said privately that he was disheartened by attacks on the courts.

articles.headline: Going Home to Falluja, a City Slipping Back Into Turmoil
articles.snippet: Times journalists visit a former ISIS stronghold and find it struggling to recover. Residents feel angry and abandoned, and militant attacks have resumed.
articles.abstract: Times journalists visit a former ISIS stronghold and find it struggling to recover. Residents feel angry and abandoned, and militant attacks have resumed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Times journalists are in Iraq’s Sunni heartland to evaluate rebuilding efforts after battles with the Islamic State.

articles.headline: The 21 Questions You’re Going to Need to Ask About Investment Fees
articles.snippet: Are financial advisers trying to part you from your money in ways you don’t understand? Ask them this set of questions.
articles.abstract: Are financial advisers trying to part you from your money in ways you don’t understand? Ask them this set of questions.
articles.lead_paragraph: So much hand-wringing over such a simple proposition: When a financial professional gives you advice about the life savings in your retirement account, that person ought to act in your best interest.
